site_name: Willoughby House 439 Richmond RoadTwickenhamTW1 2AG
description: T1 - Horse Chestnut - RemoveT3 - Common Walnut - RemoveT3 - Horse Chestnut - RemoveGroup 1 -Horse Chestnut - RemoveT4 -Tree of Heaven - RemoveT5 - Silver maple - Reduce back to the previous reduction points (3.5m). Remove all deadwood and stubs. Crown lift to 4.5m from ground level - removing small diameter secondary/ epicormic growth only.T7 - Indian Bean Tree - Pollard at a height of approx. 3m (to old reduction point on limb to the N/W and shorten/ pollard main stems to the east at around 3-3.5m from main fork)T8 + 9 - Ash - Remove lowest three secondary limbs from N/W stem (maximum diameter of 5.5cm). Remove four lowest branches over site of a maximum diameter of 8cmT12 - Ash - Remove.T14 - Silver Birch - Crown lift on south side to clear roof giving 1.5m clearance.T15 - Indian Bean Tree - Remove dead wood and epicormic growth on the low limb to the N/E. reduce back from the building to give approx. 1.5m clearance - cutting back to suitable side growth. Crown lift to statutory height over highway/ footpath.T16 - Tree of heaven - Crown thin by 20%. Remove deadwood. Remove secondary limb to the S/W at 4.8m (14cm diameter) to clear building. Remove smaller limb to the south east at 5.5m (6.5cm diameter). Remove low limb to the south east at 3.7m that overextends to the S/E (17cm diameter). Lightly reduce back any smaller growth to the south to give 1.5m clearance from the building - cutting back to suitable side growth. T18 - Yew - Remove to improve conditions in adjacent building, grind stump to approx. 10 inches below ground level.
